required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HS Students Mandatory Universal Student Instruction in CPR Appraised Learning- Is the Mandate Working?
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Factors Impacting High School Students Mandatory Universal Student Instruction in Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation Appraised Learning- Is the Mandate Working? (The High School MUSICAL Study)

lead_sponsor.agency: Kansas City Heart Rhythm Research Foundation

clinical_study.source: Kansas City Heart Rhythm Research Foundation

brief_summary.textblock: This study will help to provide better input to state health and education departments to improve the processes for CPR education. This will also help the EP council explore the opportunities to partner with other professional societies and other stake holders that have interest in this topic. Engagement of private-public partnerships for improving overall CPR education.

detailed_description.textblock: Schools should incorporate CPR education programs in the schools that will increase the knowledge, skills and awareness among high school children. It is important to note that, CPR training of young children, increases the self confidence, esteem, responsibility and contribution to their community.Moreover, it is clearly shown that, high school children has the required physical strength, maturity and positive attitude towards performing CPR in family members, friends and strangers in the community. Although some studies suggest benefit of periodic retraining, few studies have attempted to collectively identify contributing factors to comprehension.It is an attempt to identify national distribution of training efforts and factors implicated in comprehension among high school students.

primary_outcome.measure: To assess retention, effectiveness and factors impacting comprehension of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) training among high school students.
primary_outcome.description: To assess retention, effectiveness and factors impacting comprehension of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) training among high school students.

intervention.description: To assess retention, effectiveness and factors impacting comprehension of cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) training among high school students.

study_pop.textblock: High school students to whom survey is distributed. Males and females will be enrolled if they meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- High school students completing voluntary survey
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to give consent
- Inability to complete survey
